OVERVIEW: The Taglake series consists of deep, well drained soils that formed in glacial till. Taglake soils are on undulating to steep moraines. The average annual precipitation is about 20 inches, and the mean annual temperature is about 36 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, mixed, superactive Ustic Haplocryepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Taglake very stony sandy loam - woodland. (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise stated.)
01--1 inch to 0 inches; forest duff.
A2--0 to 4 inches; light gray (10YR 7/2) very stony sandy loam, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) moist; moderate fine and very fine granular structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky; medium acid (pH 6.0); clear wavy boundary. (4 to 15 inches thick)
B1--4 to 19 inches; pale brown (10YR 6/3) very stony sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) moist, with less than 50 percent light gray coatings (A2) on faces of peds; weak medium subangular blocky structure parting to moderate fine and very fine granular; hard, friable, sticky and slightly plastic; slightly acid (pH 6.2); gradual wavy boundary. (10 to 40 inches thick)
B2--19 to 24 inches; pale brown (10YR 6/3) very cobbly sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) moist; moderate  medium subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, sticky and slightly plastic; slightly acid (pH 6.4); gradual wavy boundary. (5 to 20 inches thick)
B3--24 to 60 inches; light gray (10YR 7/2) very stony sandy loam, grayish brown (10YR 5/2) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, sticky; slightly acid (pH 6.4); gradual wavy boundary.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Teton County, Wyoming; near parking lot of Signal Mountain turnoff; NE1/4 of the NW1/4 of sec. 36, T. 45 N., R. 115 W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS: The mean annual soil temperature is about 36 to 38 degrees F. The control section is sandy loam, with pebbles, cobbles and stones ranging from 35 to 50 percent.
The A horizon has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 6 or 7 dry, 3 or 4 moist and chroma of 2 or 3. It is slightly acid or medium acid.
The B2 horizon has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 5 or 6 dry, 4 or 5 moist and chroma of 3 through 6. It is very cobbly sandy loam, with gravel, cobbles and stones ranging from 35 to 50 percent. It is slightly acid or medium acid.

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES: These are the Blackleed, Devore, Garlet, Losee, Nambe, Scout and Umpa series. Blackleed soils lack an A2 horizon. Devore and Umpa soils have a lithic contact at a depth of less than 40 inches.  Garlet soils have an A&B horizon that starts at a depth below 30 inches.  Losee soils have a calcareous C horizon. Nambe and Scout soils lack light gray (A2) coatings ln the upper part of the B horizon. Also,
Scout soils have an A2 horizon thicker than 15 inches and Nambe soils are extremely acid or strongly acid.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING: Taglake soils are on undulating to steep glacial moraines. Slopes are 3 to 60 percent. The soils formed in noncalcareous till mainly from granite and gneiss. Elevation is 6,000 to 8,000 feet.  The mean annual precipitation is about 15 to 30 inches. The mean annual temperature is about 35 to 38 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: PRINCIPALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS: These are the Bearmouth, Sebud and Tineman soils. These soils have a mollic epipedon.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY: Well drained; slow to rapid runoff; moderately rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION: Used for recreation and for wildlife habitat. Native vegetation is lodgepole pine, lupine and elk sedge.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: In the hills and valleys of western Wyoming.  The series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content:
SERIES ESTABLISHED: Teton County, Wyoming, Grand Teton National Park Area, 1976.
OSED scanned by NSSQA.  Last revised by state on 4/78.

HORIZONS.name: A2
HORIZONS.narrative: A2--0 to 4 inches; light gray (10YR 7/2) very stony sandy loam, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) moist; moderate fine and very fine granular structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky; medium acid (pH 6.0); clear wavy boundary. (4 to 15 inches thick)

HORIZONS.narrative: B1--4 to 19 inches; pale brown (10YR 6/3) very stony sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) moist, with less than 50 percent light gray coatings (A2) on faces of peds; weak medium subangular blocky structure parting to moderate fine and very fine granular; hard, friable, sticky and slightly plastic; slightly acid (pH 6.2); gradual wavy boundary. (10 to 40 inches thick)

HORIZONS.narrative: B2--19 to 24 inches; pale brown (10YR 6/3) very cobbly sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) moist; moderate  medium subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, sticky and slightly plastic; slightly acid (pH 6.4); gradual wavy boundary. (5 to 20 inches thick)

HORIZONS.narrative: B3--24 to 60 inches; light gray (10YR 7/2) very stony sandy loam, grayish brown (10YR 5/2) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, sticky; slightly acid (pH 6.4); gradual wavy boundary.
